revised_title: The Consumption of Carbon in the Electric Arc: Current and Arc-Length Influence on Luminous Radiation
tldr: This study investigates the consumption of carbon in electric arcs, examining the effects of current and arc length on the loss of material and luminous radiation. The results indicate that the loss of material per coulomb decreases with increasing current for long arcs, while for short arcs, the loss increases with current. The study also shows that the loss of material is greater from the anode than the cathode under similar conditions of arc length and current.
